context: Sõrmus is an Estonian noun meaning 'ring' or 'finger-ring'. It refers to a circular piece of metal worn on the finger. The word can be found in various compound words describing different types of rings such as 'kuld|sõrmus' (gold ring), 'hõbe|sõrmus' (silver ring), and 'kihla|sõrmus' (engagement ring). In Estonian grammar, it follows declension pattern 9/katus with forms like genitive sõrmuse and partitive sõrmust.
